description: ERECTION OF A TWO STOREY REAR EXTENSION, A NEW ROOF WITH FLAT CROWN AND RAISED HIPS AND THE ERECTION OF A SIDE DORMER ROOF EXTENSION AND REAR DORMER WINDOWS.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site location plan and drawings ddh/20/515/RQ/SK09, ddh/20/515/RQ/SK10A, ddh/20/515/RQ/SK11A, ddh/20/515/RQ/SK12A, ddh/20/515/RQ/SK13, ddh/20/515/RQ/SK14, ddh/20/515/RQ/SK15A, & ddh/20/515/RQ/SK16

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved all new windows in the western elevation facing 58A Woodland Way shall be obscure glazed and fixed shut to a height of 1.7m above relative floor level. Reason; to protect the amenity and privacy of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with Policy DM D2 of the adopted Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 5 - No development shall take place until a demolition plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority detailing methods for the safe disposal of demolition waste including any hazardous materials ( including but not exclusive to asbestos) found during the process. All waste must then be disposed of as per those approved methods. Reason; To protect the environment and the safety and amenity of neighbouring residents in accordance with the requirements of policy DM EP 4 of the Adopted Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 6 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
